channel.title: Grand Theft Auto V
channel.description:
I don't know about you guys, but I've always found driving recklessly, cheat codes and killing hookers for money to be the most fun I've had in video games. http://www.rockstargames.com/videos/video/8001
Anyone else feeling excited about this?

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:452, topic:419760”]Anyone know of a good way to make money in single player?

I just completed the game, and I instantly invested my money in AUG but that is only going to give me about 60M for each character. I read about the cell phone stock top from a random event. You pick up the guy and drive him and he gives a stock tip, and you are supposed to be able to get a 3000% return on that. But any ideas how to make money after that?[/quote]

Lester missions. make sure to invest in what he tells you

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:453, topic:419760”]that cellphone tip comes in the middle of the game, I’ve never got him near the end.

I’m aware, I was responding to the idea that you need over 4GB to run on anything higher than normal and lowest shadows, when in fact I run at all the highest quality settings with a few exceptions (the advanced settings) and NVIDIA PCSS (the most expensive shadow quality).

in response to this, I actually just picked up a 980 ti, and I have GTA V maxed and I’m using about 5GB of VRAM and it runs 60fps smooth :’)[/quote]

First time I played through the game I got him at the end. Just depends. I usually leave those people till I am done with the game, because they give stock tips.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The game will use the VRAM if it is there, but the streaming tech in the game is actually very good, you can makeup for lack of memory by having your game stored on a fast storage medium (e.g. an SSD).

(I also just bought a 980 Ti :D!)

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

that cellphone tip comes in the middle of the game, I’ve never got him near the end.

tL:

I’m aware, I was responding to the idea that you need over 4GB to run on anything higher than normal and lowest shadows, when in fact I run at all the highest quality settings with a few exceptions (the advanced settings) and NVIDIA PCSS (the most expensive shadow quality).

in response to this, I actually just picked up a 980 ti, and I have GTA V maxed and I’m using about 5GB of VRAM and it runs 60fps smooth :’)

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Anyone know of a good way to make money in single player?

I just completed the game, and I instantly invested my money in AUG but that is only going to give me about 60M for each character. I read about the cell phone stock top from a random event. You pick up the guy and drive him and he gives a stock tip, and you are supposed to be able to get a 3000% return on that. But any ideas how to make money after that?

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I’m aware, I was responding to the idea that you need over 4GB to run on anything higher than normal and lowest shadows, when in fact I run at all the highest quality settings with a few exceptions (the advanced settings) and NVIDIA PCSS (the most expensive shadow quality).

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:449, topic:419760”][quote author=tL link=topic=522295.msg4486914#msg4486914 date=1434618440]

I’ve found out the hard way if you don’t have over 4GB of VRAM dedicated then you’re not going to be able to run it other than ‘normal’ and shadows the lowest possible.

That’s not true, there’s probably another cause for your issues - because I’m on two GTX 780s (3GB) SLI, I have all settings on top quality other than:

Grass Quality (High instead of Ultra)
Extended Distance Slider (0)
Extended Shadow Distance (50)

Anti-aliasing: 4xMSAA + TXAA.

I have 100+ hours in the game and I’m most of the time above 60, often into the 80s.

The game relies heavily on your page file especially if you don’t more than 8GB of system memory, so that will depend on whatever storage device your page file is enabled on (if enabled at all). I have my page file on my SSD, but I have 16GB of system memory so it shouldn’t really need to do any extensive work on the page file.
[/quote]I have a 2GB GTX 660, 24 GB of RAM but it’s sitting on my 1TB internal HDD. I don’t know my specs but I have to have bare minimum to run 60 FPS constantly.[/quote]
Just gonna put it out there, I agree with the first guy, my 2GB GTX 680 OC really struggles cause of the VRAM. 3GB is sufficient though, hence why you’re not having any problems tL, my brother has a 3GB R9 280 (which is less of a card than mine) and his runs smooth as butter.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:

[quote=“tL, post:447, topic:419760”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=522295.msg4486902#msg4486902 date=1434599588]
I’ve found out the hard way if you don’t have over 4GB of VRAM dedicated then you’re not going to be able to run it other than ‘normal’ and shadows the lowest possible.
[/quote]

That’s not true, there’s probably another cause for your issues - because I’m on two GTX 780s (3GB) SLI, I have all settings on top quality other than:

Grass Quality (High instead of Ultra)
Extended Distance Slider (0)
Extended Shadow Distance (50)

Anti-aliasing: 4xMSAA + TXAA.

I have 100+ hours in the game and I’m most of the time above 60, often into the 80s.

The game relies heavily on your page file especially if you don’t more than 8GB of system memory, so that will depend on whatever storage device your page file is enabled on (if enabled at all). I have my page file on my SSD, but I have 16GB of system memory so it shouldn’t really need to do any extensive work on the page file.[/quote]I have a 2GB GTX 660, 24 GB of RAM but it’s sitting on my 1TB internal HDD. I don’t know my specs but I have to have bare minimum to run 60 FPS constantly.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

ox random xi:

I’ve found out the hard way if you don’t have over 4GB of VRAM dedicated then you’re not going to be able to run it other than ‘normal’ and shadows the lowest possible.

That’s not true, there’s probably another cause for your issues - because I’m on two GTX 780s (3GB) SLI, I have all settings on top quality other than:

Grass Quality (High instead of Ultra)
Extended Distance Slider (0)
Extended Shadow Distance (50)

Anti-aliasing: 4xMSAA + TXAA.

I have 100+ hours in the game and I’m most of the time above 60, often into the 80s.

The game relies heavily on your page file especially if you don’t more than 8GB of system memory, so that will depend on whatever storage device your page file is enabled on (if enabled at all). I have my page file on my SSD, but I have 16GB of system memory so it shouldn’t really need to do any extensive work on the page file.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:444, topic:419760”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=522295.msg4486898#msg4486898 date=1434596903]

[quote author=Fridder link=topic=522295.msg4486896#msg4486896 date=1434595710]

Awesome, I checked out the refund policy and got a full refund in a few hours.
[/quote]Modding singeplayer is still one of the funner aspects of the game still.

I only bought it on PC to mod single player.
[/quote]then why’d ya refund it haha

I couldn’t play, either my computer would freeze entirely or the game would stop working. Maybe its because I’m using windows 10 or maybe its my shitty hardware… either way I was getting a decent 50fps on normal settings but it kept crashing.[/quote]I’ve found out the hard way if you don’t have over 4GB of VRAM dedicated then you’re not going to be able to run it other than ‘normal’ and shadows the lowest possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:438, topic:419760”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=522295.msg4486813#msg4486813 date=1434511257]
Bought it yesterday through Steam. Both my computer and the game would crash around 10 minutes. I’d get the occasional “GTA V has stopped working”, and I lost my campaign progress about 3 or 4 times before giving up. Online multiplayer was full of modders killing everyone. Much more enjoyable on xbox one.
[/quote]

Should look into steams return policy. I believe if you have played under 2 hours of the game you can request a refund.[/quote]
Yes. I actually just refunded Assetto Corsa today and it went through within hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Fridder:

Bought it yesterday through Steam. Both my computer and the game would crash around 10 minutes. I’d get the occasional “GTA V has stopped working”, and I lost my campaign progress about 3 or 4 times before giving up. Online multiplayer was full of modders killing everyone. Much more enjoyable on xbox one.

Should look into steams return policy. I believe if you have played under 2 hours of the game you can request a refund.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

The only problems I had was installing the retail discs (my drive wouldn’t read them, so I had to use another) and starting missions where time passed by: sometimes the game would just instantly lose a ton of fps until I restarted.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:432, topic:419760”]Game is pretty good. A lot of people are having a hard time running it at 60fps with max settings, but I’m running it just fine. Has a few hiccups here and there that requires a game restart, but hopefully those will be fixed over time. All in all, not bad.[/quote]I love the game so far, just crashing every hour or two is the pain for me right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

It is if you’ve waited all this time without playing the inferior versions of the game, and have a strong enough pc to run it at 60fps+

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Travas:

Game is pretty good. A lot of people are having a hard time running it at 60fps with max settings, but I’m running it just fine. Has a few hiccups here and there that requires a game restart, but hopefully those will be fixed over time. All in all, not bad.

worth the wait or nah?

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto V
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Game is pretty good. A lot of people are having a hard time running it at 60fps with max settings, but I’m running it just fine. Has a few hiccups here and there that requires a game restart, but hopefully those will be fixed over time. All in all, not bad.

Read full topic
